Package sait.bms.managers

Class BookManagementSystem

java.lang.Object
sait.bms.managers.BookManagementSystem
public class BookManagementSystem
extends java.lang.Object
This class is used to manage the operations of the Book Management System program.
Author:
Nathan Ryan

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    java.util.ArrayList<Books> bookList
    This private ArrayList of Books objects contains the entire catalog of books, once loaded upon initialization of the program.
    private static java.lang.String FILE_NAME
    This constant is used to store the relative path of the text file that is to be loaded into an ArrayList.
    private java.util.Scanner keyboard
    A scanner object to read input from the user.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    BookManagementSystem()
    This constructor creates an ArrayList of Books objects, and initializes a Scanner object to read keyboard input.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void checkoutBook()
    This method enables a user to search for a book using an ISBN#.
    private void displayByType()
    Allows a patron to view a list of books with a specific type.
    void displayMenu()
    This method is the main menu display.
    private void findByTitle()
    This method returns a formatted result based upon a user entered query.
    private void loadBookList()
    This method loads a text file into an ArrayList of Book objects.
    private void randomBookList()
    This method generates a list of random books the size of which is dependent upon a user inputed number, formatted individually based upon the specific type of book that is printed.
    private void saveChanges()
    This method saves the changes made to the movie catalog, and updates the source file accordingly.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • BookManagementSystem

      public BookManagementSystem() throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      This constructor creates an ArrayList of Books objects, and initializes a Scanner object to read keyboard input.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - - throws FileNotFoundException

  • Method Details

    • loadBookList

      private void loadBookList() throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      This method loads a text file into an ArrayList of Book objects. The file is read line by line, and for each line, it is split based upon a specific delimiter pattern, in this case, a comma. The split line is then parsed (if necessary), and then stored in a temporary Book object before it is added to the book catalog ArrayList.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - throws FileNotFoundException

    • displayMenu

      public void displayMenu() throws java.io.IOException
      This method is the main menu display. A user is able to add a movie, generate a list of movies released in a year, and to generate a random list of movies based upon a user inputed number. There is a sentinel value which allows the program to save the updated changes to the movie catalog (if any), and exit the program.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - throws InputOutputException

    • checkoutBook

      private void checkoutBook()
      This method enables a user to search for a book using an ISBN#. If the book is unavailable, the user will be informed and the program goes back to the main menu. If the book is available, the user will be prompted to see if they would like to check out the book, if so, available count will be decremented and the book info will be displayed

    • findByTitle

      private void findByTitle()
      This method returns a formatted result based upon a user entered query. It runs by scanning the books catalog to determine whether or not there is a match between the user query and the title.

    • displayByType

      private void displayByType()
      Allows a patron to view a list of books with a specific type. The user will also enter a format, diet, genre, or frequency (depending on the type of book) and the book list will be narrowed down further.

    • randomBookList

      private void randomBookList()
      This method generates a list of random books the size of which is dependent upon a user inputed number, formatted individually based upon the specific type of book that is printed.

    • saveChanges

      private void saveChanges() throws java.io.IOException
      This method saves the changes made to the movie catalog, and updates the source file accordingly.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - throws an InputOutput exception
